Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Floating \Float"ing\, n. 1. (Weaving) Floating threads. See {Floating threads}, above. [1913 Webster]
2. The second coat of three-coat plastering. --Knight. [1913 Webster]
3. The process of rendering oysters and scallops plump by placing them in fresh or brackish water; -- called also {fattening}, {plumping}, and {laying out}. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fatten \Fat"ten\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Fattened}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Fattening}.] [See {Fat}, v. t.] 1. To make fat; to feed for slaughter; to make fleshy or plump with fat; to fill full; to fat. [1913 Webster]
2. To make fertile and fruitful; to enrich; as, to fatten land; to fatten fields with blood. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
fattening adj : subject to or used in the process of finishing or fattening up for slaughter; "a fattening hog"; "fattening pens"
